body.p: Common workflows for working with Git.

section.title: All on one branch (all in one boat)
section.p: We all work with the same project(s) on the same branch. We have separate branches which mark past releases. For features which may take a longer time to implement, we connect them to the live content when they are done.

Common workflow:
Check in the project (one time operation).
Pull to get changes from the main repository.
Commit and push changes.
Deal with possible conflicts which may appear.
Request review either before commit or after the change was incorporated in the main branch.

Workflow for updating documentation for a past release:
Switch to branch specific for that release.
Pull to get changes from the main repository.
Commit and push changes.
Deal with possible conflicts which may appear.

ul.li: Create a branch on which you work on a larger feature either by yourself or with some other colleagues.
You can also request review on the branch.
When finished, merge the branch in the main repository branch or create a pull request to merge the branch.

dlentry.dd: Commit often, whenever a small change makes sense by itself. Useful links:
Instead of merging your feature branch directly in the main branch, create a pull request to allow a colleague to review and integrate the change.
